Orbit.name: Orbit
Orbit.description: Namespace for core Orbit methods and classes.

classes.name: Orbit.Action
classes.description:
`Action` provides a wrapper for actions that are performed in an `ActionQueue`.

Actions can maintain optional metadata such as `id` and `data`. This metadata
makes it easier to identify actions within a queue. It can also be used by
actions themselves during processing.

Each Action is associated with a function that should be invoked. This function
can be synchronous or asynchronous.

`process` wraps the call to the function with a promise.

Each Action can only succeed once. On failure, the `processing` promise will
be reset and the action can be tried again.

props.name: process
props.description: A function that performs the action

classes.name: Orbit.ActionQueue
classes.description:
`ActionQueue` is a FIFO queue of actions that should be performed sequentially.

Actions are added to the queue with `push`. Each action will be processed by
calling its `process` method.

If action calls return a promise, then that promise will be settled before the
next action is de-queued and called. If action calls don't return anything,
then the next action will be de-queued and called immediately.

By default, ActionQueues will be processed automatically, as soon as actions
are pushed to them. This can be overridden by setting the `autoProcess` option
to `false` and then by calling `process` when you'd like to start processing.

props.name: autoProcess
props.description:
Are actions automatically
                  processed as soon as they are pushed?

classes.name: Orbit.Class
classes.description: A base class that can be extended.

classes.name: Orbit.Document
classes.description:
`Document` is a complete implementation of the JSON PATCH spec detailed in
[RFC 6902](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902).

A document can be manipulated via a `transform` method that accepts an
`operation`, or with the methods `add`, `remove`, `replace`, `move`, `copy` and
`test`.

Data at a particular path can be retrieved from a `Document` with `retrieve()`.

params.name: data
params.description: The initial data for the document

props.name: arrayBasedPaths
props.description: Should paths be array based, or `'/'` delimited (the default)?

classItems.description:
Reset the contents of the whole document.

If no data is specified, the contents of the document will be reset to an
empty object.
classItems.name: reset

classItems.description:
Retrieve the value at a path.

If the path does not exist in the document, `PathNotFoundException` will be
thrown by default. If `quiet` is truthy, `undefined` will be returned
instead.
classItems.name: retrieve

params.name: quiet
params.description: Return `undefined` instead of throwing an exception if `path` can't be found?

classItems.description:
Sets the value at a path.

If the target location specifies an array index, inserts a new value
into the array at the specified index.

If the target location specifies an object member that does not
already exist, adds a new member to the object.

If the target location specifies an object member that does exist,
replaces that member's value.

If the target location does not exist, throws `PathNotFoundException`.
classItems.name: add

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classItems.description:
Removes the value from a path.

If removing an element from an array, shifts any elements above the
specified index one position to the left.

If the target location does not exist, throws `PathNotFoundException`.
classItems.name: remove

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classItems.description:
Replaces the value at a path.

This operation is functionally identical to a "remove" operation for
a value, followed immediately by an "add" operation at the same
location with the replacement value.

If the target location does not exist, throws `PathNotFoundException`.
classItems.name: replace

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classItems.description:
Moves an object from one path to another.

Identical to calling `remove()` followed by `add()`.

Throws `PathNotFoundException` if either path does not exist in the document.
classItems.name: move

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classItems.description:
Copies an object at one path and adds it to another.

Identical to calling `add()` with the value at `fromPath`.

Throws `PathNotFoundException` if either path does not exist in the document.
classItems.name: copy

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classItems.description:
Tests that the value at a path matches an expectation.

Uses `Orbit.eq` to test equality.

Throws `PathNotFoundException` if the path does not exist in the document.
classItems.name: test

params.name: quiet
params.description: Use `undefined` instead of throwing an exception if `path` can't be found?

classItems.description:
Transforms the document with an RFC 6902-compliant operation.

Throws `PathNotFoundException` if the path does not exist in the document.
classItems.name: transform

props.name: from
props.description: Path to source target location. Required for "copy" and "move"

props.name: value
props.description: Value to set. Required for "add", "replace" and "test"

return.description: Array of inverse operations if `invert === true`

classes.name: Orbit.Evented

classItems.description: Mixes the `Evented` interface into an object
classItems.name: extend

classes.name: Orbit.Exception
classes.description: Base Exception

classes.name: Orbit.Notifier

classItems.description:
Add a callback as a listener, which will be triggered when sending
notifications.
classItems.name: addListener

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to call as a notification

classItems.description: Remove a listener so that it will no longer receive notifications.
classItems.name: removeListener

classItems.description:
Notify registered listeners.

Any responses from listeners will be ignored.
classItems.name: emit

params.name: Any
params.description: number of parameters to be sent to listeners

classItems.description:
Poll registered listeners.

Any responses from listeners will be returned in an array.
classItems.name: poll

params.name: Any
params.description: number of parameters to be sent to listeners

classes.name: Orbit.Operation
classes.description:
`Operation` provides a thin wrapper over a JSON Patch operation.

Operations maintain the standard Patch attributes: `op`, `path`, and `value`.

Operations are automatically assigned a UUID `id`. They can maintain their
ancestry in a `log`. In this way, it is possible to determine whether
operations preceded each other.

Operations can `spawn` descendants, which automatically adds the parent to
the child's history.

props.name: parent
props.description: parent operation that spawned this one

classes.name: Orbit.PathNotFoundException
classes.description: Exception thrown when a path in a document can not be found.

classes.name: Orbit.RequestConnector
classes.description:
A `RequestConnector` observes requests made to a primary source and allows a
secondary source to either "assist" or "rescue" those requests.

A `RequestConnector` can operate in one of two modes:

- In the default `"rescue"` mode, the secondary source will only be called upon
to fulfill a request if the primary source fails to do so.

- In `"assist"` mode, the secondary source will be called upon to fulfill a
request before the primary source. Only if the secondary source fails to
fulfill the request will the primary source be called upon to do so.

Unlike a `TransformConnector`, a `RequestConnector` always blocks
asynchronous requests before proceeding. In other words, any promises that
are returned from requests will be settled (either succeeding or failing)
before the connector proceeds.

props.name: active
props.description: Is the connector is actively observing the `primarySource`?

classItems.description: Should return the handler for a Requestable action.

return.description: handler to call for that action

classes.name: Orbit.TransformConnector
classes.description:
A `TransformConnector` observes a source's transforms and applies them to a
target.

Each connector is "one way", so bi-directional synchronization between sources
requires the creation of two connectors.

A `TransformConnector` can operate in one of two modes:

- In the default "blocking" mode, a connector will return a promise to the
`didTransform` event, which will prevent the original transform from resolving
until the promise itself has resolved.

- In "non-blocking" mode, transforms do not block the resolution of the original
transform - asynchronous actions are performed afterward.

The connector's `transform` method actually applies transforms to its target.
This method attempts to retrieve the current value at the path of the
transformation and resolves any conflicts with the connector's
`resolveConflicts` method. By default, a simple differential is applied to the
target, although both `transform` and `resolveConflicts` can be overridden to
apply an alternative differencing algorithm.

props.name: blocking
props.description: Does the connector wait for promises to be settled?

props.name: active
props.description: Is the connector is actively observing the `source`?

return.description: `true` if the operation should be processed

OC.name: OC
OC.description: Namespace for Orbit Common methods and classes.

classes.name: OC.Cache
classes.description:
`Cache` provides a thin wrapper over an internally maintained instance of a
`Document`.

`Cache` prepares records to be cached according to a specified schema. The
schema also determines the paths at which records will be stored.

Once cached, data can be accessed at a particular path with `retrieve`. The
size of data at a path can be accessed with `length`.

classItems.description: Return the size of data at a particular path
classItems.name: length

classItems.description:
Return data at a particular path.

Returns `undefined` if the path does not exist in the document.
classItems.name: retrieve

classItems.description:
Retrieves a link value.  Returns a null value for empty links.
For hasOne links will return a string id value of the link.
For hasMany links will return an array of id values.
Returns whether a path exists in the document.
classItems.name: exists

classItems.description:
Transforms the document with an RFC 6902-compliant operation.

Currently limited to `add`, `remove` and `replace` operations.
classItems.name: transform

props.name: value
props.description: Value to set. Required for "add" and "replace"

classes.name: OC.CacheIntegrityProcessor
classes.description:
An operation processor that ensures that a cache's data is consistent and
doesn't contain any dead references.

This is achieved by maintaining a mapping of reverse links for each record.
When a record is removed, any references to it can also be identified and
removed.

params.name: schema
params.description: Schema used to define the data structure and relationships.

params.name: retrieve
params.description: Function used to retrieve data at a specific `path`.

classes.name: OC.JSONAPISource
classes.description: Source for accessing a JSON API compliant RESTful API with AJAX

classes.name: OC.LinkNotFoundException
classes.description: Exception thrown when a record can not be found.

classes.name: OC.LocalStorageSource
classes.description: Source for storing data in local storage

classes.name: OC.MemorySource
classes.description: Source for storing in-memory data

classes.name: OC.OperationNotAllowed
classes.description: Exception thrown when an operation is not allowed.

classes.name: OC.OperationProcessor
classes.description:
Operation processors are used to identify operations that should be performed
together to ensure that a `Cache` or other container of data remains
consistent and correct.

`OperationProcessor` is an abstract base class to be extended by specific
operation processors.

params.name: schema
params.description: Schema used to define the data structure and relationships.

params.name: retrieve
params.description: Function used to retrieve data at a specific `path`.

classItems.description:
Called when all the `data` in a cache has been reset.

The return value is ignored.

params.name: data
params.description: a complete replacement set of data

classItems.description:
Called before an `operation` has been applied.

Return an array of operations to be applied **BEFORE** the `operation` itself
is applied.

Called before an `operation` has been applied.

Return an array of operations to be applied **AFTER** the `operation` itself
is applied.

Called **AFTER** an `operation` and any related operations have been
applied.

Return an array of operations to be applied **AFTER** `operation` itself
is applied.

classes.name: OC.RecordAlreadyExistsException
classes.description: Exception thrown when a record already exists.

classes.name: OC.RecordNotFoundException
classes.description: Exception thrown when a record can not be found.

classes.name: OC.Schema

props.name: models
props.description: schemas for individual models supported by this schema

classItems.description:
Registers a model's schema definition.

Emits the `modelRegistered` event upon completion.

Normalizes a record according to its type and corresponding schema
definition.

A record's primary key, links, and meta data will all be initialized.

A record can only be normalized once. A flag is set on the record
(`__normalized`) to prevent "re-normalization".

Given a data object structured according to this schema, register all of its
primary and secondary key mappings. This data object may contain any number
of records and types.

params.name: data
params.description: - data structured according to this schema

classItems.description:
A naive pluralization method.

Override with a more robust general purpose inflector or provide an
inflector tailored to the vocabularly of your application.

A naive singularization method.

Override with a more robust general purpose inflector or provide an
inflector tailored to the vocabularly of your application.

classes.name: OC.SchemaConsistencyProcessor
classes.description:
An operation processor that ensures that a cache's data is consistent with
its associated schema.

This includes maintenance of inverse links and dependent links.

params.name: schema
params.description: Schema used to define the data structure and relationships.

params.name: retrieve
params.description: Function used to retrieve data at a specific `path`.

classes.name: OC.Source
classes.description: `Source` is an abstract base class to be extended by other sources.

classItems.description:
Internal method that applies a single transform to this source.

`_transform` must be implemented by a `Transformable` source.
It is called by the public method `transform` in order to actually apply
transforms.

`_transform` should return a promise if the operation is asynchronous.
classItems.name: _transform

params.name: operation
params.description: JSON PATCH operation as detailed in RFC 6902

classItems.description:
A place to track the creation of any Source, is called in the Source init
method.  The source might not be fully configured / setup by the time you
receive it, but we provide this hook for potential debugging tools to monitor
all sources.
